items.title: BSE shares in focus as NSE moves weekly expiry to Tuesday
items.description: BSE shares: NSE has shifted Nifty weekly contract expiry from Thursday to Tuesday, reshaping trading strategies and boosting prospects for Sensex derivatives.

items.title: IGL shares in focus after formation of solar JV with Rajasthan government
items.description: IGL shares: Indraprastha Gas Ltd (IGL) has formed a joint venture with Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd to set up a solar power project in Rajasthan, marking its entry into the renewable energy sector.

items.title: Torrent Power, Ashok Leyland among 8 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.description: There was a notable surge in futures open interest for nine stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 7% as of September 1, in comparison to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies a substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market."

items.title: Sebi to impose fresh intraday derivative position limits from October 1
items.description: Sebi has introduced a new framework to monitor intraday positions in index options, effective October 1. The rules cap net and gross intraday exposure, mandate random compliance checks, and impose expiry-day penalties to curb aggressive bets while balancing liquidity and institutional participation in the derivatives market.

items.title: Tata Motors, M&M among 10 Nifty stocks showing RSI Trending Up
items.description: Ten stocks from the Nifty50 pack were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan on September 1, based on data from stockedge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the price of the stock. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp shares in focus as August sales jump 8% YoY to 5.54 lakh units
items.description: Hero MotoCorp share price: The automaker reported an 8% YoY rise in August sales to 5.54 lakh units. Motorcycles and scooters both saw growth, while exports surged 72%. The company also highlighted steady electric sales and festive season optimism.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: UltraTech Cement, SRF among 5 stocks that could give 13-40% return
items.description: Brokerages have turned positive on a diverse set of companies across sectors, underlining strong earnings visibility, sectoral tailwinds, and expansion-driven growth opportunities.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Patanjali Foods, Prestige Estates among 13 dividend stocks to watch: Last day to buy
items.description: Investors eyeing dividend payouts should note today is the last day to buy shares of Patanjali Foods and Prestige Estates Projects to qualify for final dividends. Patanjali Foods announced a 100% dividend (Rs 2/share), while Prestige Estates declared 18% (Rs 1.8/share). Other companies with September 3rd as the record date include Concord Biotech (1070%), V.S.T.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 9 midcap stocks close cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the NSE midcap pack, nine stocks' close prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on September 1, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily time frame, it is generally considered to be an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: NIS Management IPO to list on September 2. Here's what GMP indicates
items.description: Kolkata's NIS Management, a security and facility management firm, is set to debut on the BSE SME platform. The IPO, priced at ₹105-111, saw moderate subscription, led by non-institutional investors. The company plans to use the ₹60.01 crore raised for working capital and general purposes. Despite full subscription, grey market activity is nil, suggesting a debut around the issue price.

items.title: Indian local funds’ stock buying nears record as foreigners exit
items.description: Indian institutions are close to a record in stock purchases this year. This cushions the market as foreign funds sell. Local investors have bought over $59 billion in equities. Foreigners have withdrawn $14 billion in 2025. Retail participation drives most inflows. Investors are moving from traditional savings to equity funds. Local institutions' ownership hit a record high.

items.title: Asian stocks edge up, Japan bond auction in focus
items.description: Asian stocks saw modest gains, driven by technology and AI sectors, particularly Alibaba's surge. Investors are eyeing upcoming jobs and inflation data, along with the Federal Reserve's rate decision, amid historical September market weakness. Meanwhile, Indonesian markets face political risks, and longer-maturity bonds brace for a potentially challenging month.

items.title: GIFT Nifty up 25 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Nifty recovered following three days of losses, boosted by robust GDP growth figures. Despite a positive domestic outlook, potential US tariffs and continuous selling by foreign investors may limit market gains. Technically, the index faces resistance below 25,000, while strong support lies at 24,350, with the rupee hitting a record low.

items.title: Stocks in news: Hero MotoCorp, Hyundai India, IGL, Maruti Suzuki, BEL
items.description: The markets opened positively, buoyed by strong Q1 GDP figures. Hero MotoCorp reported an 8% YoY increase in sales, while Hyundai India saw a 4% dip. Maruti Suzuki began exporting its first BEV, the eVITARA, and BEL secured additional orders worth ₹644 crore.

items.title: Can Jubilant Ingrevia sustain its recovery after recent challenges?
items.description: Jubilant Ingrevia shares are recovering after a period of decline. Domestic operations and limited US exposure shield it from tariffs. EU's anti-dumping duty on Chinese choline chloride benefits the company. Capacity expansion and agriculture sector opportunities drive growth. Cost optimization measures are expected to improve margins. The company anticipates higher choline chloride exports to Europe.

items.title: Stock market's fate comes down to next 14 trading sessions
items.description: Wall Street faces a crucial period as key economic reports and the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision loom. The stock market, showing signs of uncertainty after a modest August gain, enters historically weak September. Despite low volatility, analysts predict a potential fall correction before a year-end rebound, creating a tricky environment for investors.

items.title: OLA Electric among 6 stocks that rose above VWAP on September 1
items.description: On September 1, the closing prices of seven stocks in the Nifty200 pack rallied over 1.5% relative to their VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price), and a shift above the VWAP suggests a potential bullish trend, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.When the closing price rises above the VWAP, it signifies that the closing price is higher than the average price at which it was traded throughout the day, with the average being weighted by trading volume. This occurrence is often interpreted as a potential bullish signal by traders and investors. Potentially indicating positive sentiment in the market.
